Answer: Here’s one. Rita Wilson, Tom Hanks’ wife, saw a play and wanted to make a movie of it. They felt it could be done for $5 million. Hanks personally went to every studio in town to make it—they all turned him down.Now let me interject—Who says no to Tom Hanks? Especially for a measly $5 million? Had any of them said yes, he would now owe them a favor. And then they could have called him and said, “We want you to play Green Goblin in the new Spider-Man movie” and he would have done it. But they all said “not interested.”So they made the movie themselves, using their own money and a few bucks scraHere’s one. Rita Wilson, Tom Hanks’ wife, saw a play and wanted to make a movie of it. They felt it could be done for $5 million. Hanks personally went to every studio in town to make it—they all turned him down.Now let me interject—Who says no to Tom Hanks? Especially for a measly $5 million? Had any of them said yes, he would now owe them a favor. And then they could have called him and said, “We want you to play Green Goblin in the new Spider-Man movie” and he would have done it. But they all said “not interested.”So they made the movie themselves, using their own money and a few bucks scraped together from outside investors. They then shopped it around, and guess what? Every studio in town turned it down—Finally, they made a deal with a tiny spin-off company called IFC. The picture opened and took in $250 million North American theatrical in 2002 dollars (about $400 million today), the biggest gross ever for an independent film until PASSION OF THE CHRIST (and still #2). On a budget of $5 million—tens of millions of profit that could have gone to any studio had just one of them said yes.The name of that movie? (Scroll down.)>>>>>MY BIG FAT GREEK WEDDING.

Dusts spill down as if someone is walking upstairs.Bob talks about the film that Zodiac quoted from.Bob moves into the dark againHis face is hidden in the shade. Answer: To my amazement, many movies in genre of Science-Fiction and Technology based have come out and among them some movies stand class apart in terms of concept, visualization, storytelling and presentation. Some movies are linear narrated and whereas some are non-linear and that’s where the curiosity spikes in for the viewers.This list is based on the movies which i have watched.Alien (1979)Alien is a science-fiction horror film franchise centered on a film series that depicts Warrant Officer Ellen Ripley and her battles with an extraterrestrial lifeform, commonly referred to as "the Alien"Back tTo my amazement, many movies in genre of Science-Fiction and Technology based have come out and among them some movies stand class apart in terms of concept, visualization, storytelling and presentation. Some movies are linear narrated and whereas some are non-linear and that’s where the curiosity spikes in for the viewers.This list is based on the movies which i have watched.Alien (1979)Alien is a science-fiction horror film franchise centered on a film series that depicts Warrant Officer Ellen Ripley and her battles with an extraterrestrial lifeform, commonly referred to as "the Alien"Back to the Future Trilogy (1985, 1989, 1990)Marty travels back in time using a time machine invented by an eccentric scientist. He meets his parents there and accidentally attracts his mother's attention. He must make his parents fall in love.Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991)A future terminator is set on a mission to kill Sarah's son, John Connor. A cyborg, who once was after the life of Sarah, has been assigned to protect both mother and the son.Dark City (1998)John awakens in a hotel with no memory and learns that he's wanted for a series of murders. In trying to find answers, he discovers a group of aliens called the Strangers who are controlling the city.The Matrix Trilogy (1999, 2003)Thomas, a computer programmer, is led to fight an underground war against powerful computers who now rule the world with a system called 'The Matrix'.Minority Report (2002)A future technology makes it possible for cops to catch criminals before a crime is committed. John Anderton is accused of one such crime and sets out to prove his innocence.Equilibrium (2002)In a world where every form of human emotion is prohibited, Preston, an officer responsible for implementing the law, decides to revolt against it.The Island (2005)Lincoln Six Echo is just like everyone else as he waits to go to the island. But he soon discovers that everything about his existence is a lie and that he and the other inhabitants are human clones.Sunshine (2007)A team of international astronauts are sent on a dangerous mission to reignite the dying Sun with a nuclear fission bomb in 2057.District 9 (2009)A bunch of aliens is forced to live in pathetic conditions on Earth. They, however, find support in a government agent who is responsible for their relocation.Inception (2010)Cobb steals information from his targets by entering their dreams. He is wanted for his alleged role in his wife's murder and his only chance at redemption is to perform the impossible, an inception.The Adjustment Bureau (2011)The affair between a politician and a contemporary dancer is affected by mysterious forces keeping the lovers apart.Source Code (2011)Army pilot Stevens, recruited for a top-secret operation, finds himself in the body of an unknown man. Soon, he is on a mysterious trail to track down the bomber of the Chicago commuter trainLooper (2012)Set in a near future, mobsters send their victims back in time to get them executed by the 'loopers'. Joe, one such looper, finds himself to be the victim of his own actions.Elysium (2013)Max undertakes a dangerous mission to the luxurious space station inhabited by the rich to save his own life. His journey results in the end of injustice and brings equality to the people on earth.Snowpiercer (2013)A post-apocalyptic ice age forces humanity's last survivors aboard a globe-spanning supertrain. One man (Chris Evans) will risk everything to lead a revolt for control of the engine and the future of the world.Edge of Tomorrow (2014)With the help of warrior Rita Vrataski, Major William Cage has to save Planet Earth from an alien species, after being caught in a time loop. Does he have the skills to exterminate the aliens?Interstellar (2014)In the future, Earth is slowly becoming uninhabitable. Ex-NASA pilot Cooper, along with a team of researchers, is sent on a planet exploration mission to report which planet can sustain life.Predestination (2014)A temporal agent (Ethan Hawke) embarks on a final time-traveling assignment to prevent an elusive criminal from launching an attack that kills thousands of people.

Answer: Lilo and Stitch.It’s not your typical kind of Disney movie. Lilo and Nani are not “princesses.” (I hate all of the princess shit Disney had been promoting for the past 40 years. I don’t see how winning a birth lottery is something girls should aspire to.) They’re minorities, they come from an underprivileged family. Nani’s struggle with supporting the family while taking care of her little sister feels authentic. And the family, which indeed gets better at the end of the movie, doesn’t become super rich. The girls don’t discover some ridiculous treasure or uncover long lost famous/rich parentsLilo and Stitch.It’s not your typical kind of Disney movie. Lilo and Nani are not “princesses.” (I hate all of the princess shit Disney had been promoting for the past 40 years. I don’t see how winning a birth lottery is something girls should aspire to.) They’re minorities, they come from an underprivileged family. Nani’s struggle with supporting the family while taking care of her little sister feels authentic. And the family, which indeed gets better at the end of the movie, doesn’t become super rich. The girls don’t discover some ridiculous treasure or uncover long lost famous/rich parents who solve all their problems. It’s still a broken family of two sisters trying to make a life for themselves.It’s about family and friendship and the movie didn’t make romance or “true love” the theme of the movie. Nani had a boyfriend, but their relationship was never the focus of the movie. There’s no Prince Charming or dashing rogue coming to rescue.And considering it came out back in 2002, it’s pretty refreshing. We have to wait for another 15 years for a minority girl featured in a Disney movie who didn’t end up with some Prince Charming.On top of all that, the movie was gorgeous. It is the last watercolor animation feature film Disney made. The Hawaiian environment is beautifully rendered, with a full panel of watercolor background.They don’t make movies like that anymore. After all, Disney has focused on their 3D Pixar production.

Answer: Thabks for the askAlthough technology changes fast, the method of learning and creation doesnt really change except for grow.Dont look at the number of features of a new technology as an obstacle.Create a template of learning so that you are focusing on the key concepts and key functions, then create a template where you can apply that to your current situation.Mimicking this template across another technology and see what you can add or subtract.Take object oriented program for example.The syntax changes but the same loops are the same.If elseWhile doSorting algorithmsThey all have the same fThabks for the askAlthough technology changes fast, the method of learning and creation doesnt really change except for grow.Dont look at the number of features of a new technology as an obstacle.Create a template of learning so that you are focusing on the key concepts and key functions, then create a template where you can apply that to your current situation.Mimicking this template across another technology and see what you can add or subtract.Take object oriented program for example.The syntax changes but the same loops are the same.If elseWhile doSorting algorithmsThey all have the same function and can be applied to different languages and technologies.Hence you create something that is the same throughout so you dont get overwhelmed with the new technology.

Answer: @Now, I'm not saying you can just catch the gravy train and never get off. You have to be aware of what's happening around you and stay flexible. But, as long as you're happy with what you're doing, keep digging and improving your practice and your knowledge of the language and tech your currently working with. Un@Now, I'm not saying you can just catch the gravy train and never get off. You have to be aware of what's happening around you and stay flexible. But, as long as you're happy with what you're doing, keep digging and improving your practice and your knowledge of the language and tech your currently working with. Unless you're very unlucky, thete is likely always to be work in your niche.Now, the caveat: do not be blind to architecture and software engineering practices, including project and people (ie fellow engineers) management. Its in these areas that your experience will grow and be appreciated beyond the confines of your particular technical expertise. Technology does change but your ability to switch improves because you've done it once already in a particular niche. Convincing a new employer that you're worth hiring to tackle a new tech will be enhanced because of your experience in an older tech.So, don't try and master the latest and greatest piece of new tech whenever it appears, but do be aware of it. Instead hone what you do and keep learning how do it better.

Answer: The “fundamentals” of Computer Science changes very slowly. The economics changes rapidly!Automata Theory: Does not changeFoundation for what can be computed, how to state machines to recognize inputs (which leads to pattern matching and compilers).Algorithms: Changes very slowlyThe most important algorithms have not changed in decades. Answer: Only a quarter of 2019 is gone, but we already have the opportunity to monitor some of the crucial blockchain trends that will reshape this technology for the remainder of the year.2019 is making a strong case to be regarded as the ‘versus’ year for blockchain technology, and all I can say is that the ‘fight card’ is exciting for sure.In this response, I will outline some of the hot button trends that are dominating conversations around blockchain technology. The key ones include;Only a quarter of 2019 is gone, but we already have the opportunity to monitor some of the crucial blockchain trends that will reshape this technology for the remainder of the year.2019 is making a strong case to be regarded as the ‘versus’ year for blockchain technology, and all I can say is that the ‘fight card’ is exciting for sure.In this response, I will outline some of the hot button trends that are dominating conversations around blockchain technology. The key ones include;Proof of Work vs. Proof of StakeOne of the areas in blockchain technology that is characterized by a high level of contention is related to determining the superior consensus algorithm between PoW and PoS. At the center of this debate are two leading blockchains in Bitcoin and Ethereum. While Bitcoin uses PoW, Ethereum is seeking to migrate to PoS.Proponents of PoW are convinced that their algorithm is the only way to secure the network from malicious actions truly. For this reason, energy consumption is the sacrifice that needs to be made to protect this network.In contrast, supporters of PoS are focusing on scaling their blockchain and minimize its energy consumption. As such, they contend that this algorithm offers the best option of achieving these objectives while consolidating the network’s security at the same time.Valued at $12.9 billion, Ethereum is the second largest blockchain in terms of market share behind Bitcoin. Ethereum is looking to shift from its current PoW model to PoS to scale its network and make it capable of handling multiple transactions every second.The first step for developers is to apply the Constantinople fork to facilitate the inclusion of prerequisite modifications for PoS. While the fork was postponed in January 2019 because of an inherent safety issue, it is in line to be conducted again soon.The fundamental question that arises is whether all the blockchains seeking to move from PoW will be successful. My best bet is to remain observant and see where the industry is headed. However, I also believe that the market has room for more than one consensus algorithms that have various benefits and shortcomings. For this reason, there is an excellent chance that we may not see an outright winner.A Single Blockchain to Control Everything Vs. a Collection of Blockchains with Diverse FeaturesThis issue is considered as one of the most divisive talking points when it comes to blockchain technology in 2019. On the one hand, some maximalists are convinced that all transactions, dApps, and more will be executed on a single blockchain in the long run.In contrast, the other camp comprises individuals who hold the view that the existence of various kinds of blockchains that can facilitate the execution of different tasks and for adoption is necessary.While I can't predict the camp that will prevail, the truth of the situation is that there is an extensive collection of projects focused on different blockchains already. My conviction is that competition will always exist, and ultimately, it is beneficial for everyone. My view is informed by the fact that some blockchains are based on absolute decentralization, while others are centered on being public-private hybrids suitable for use in specific sectors.STOs vs ICOsThe conflict between registered securities and unrecognized emissions of tokens may end up without a logical winner, or with both being adopted.Although it is becoming more apparent that securities will be used in blockchain technology to minimize capital expenses and improve access to the money market for SMEs and other economic players, ICOs have the potential to play a big part in the future of blockchain technology because they provide a means to come up with a complete ecosystem around a particular asset or platform.Bakkt and Derivatives for Cryptocurrencies vs. Anti-institutional SentimentFor some purists, institutional investors should not be allowed into the derivatives’ market characterized by products such as ETFs, Bakkt, among others. Their logic is that institutional participation would result in a high level of volatility in the industry to the detriment of retail investors.On the other hand, some stakeholders believe that allowing institutional participation will make it easier for more people to access the market, which will translate to quicker industry growth.The rationale behind both points of view is decent. However, I am convinced that institutional investment is welcome if the industry is to attain maturity and further expansion.Scalability and Speed v DecentralizationIf blockchain technology is to attain real-world adoption, scaling is a core necessity.However, the ideas regarding how this should be done differ among stakeholders. Most critics contend that most projects with high TPS managed to scale to this level at the expense of network decentralization. The outcome of this development was the loss of the vital aim of blockchain in the process.An alternative idea to be applied, and executed upon, is to consolidate a balance between the two with a layer 2 off-chain transaction.Overall, scalability, speed, decentralization, and off-chain transactions represent some of the hot button issues in this industry. Their significance is not limited to a technological perspective, but also how vital they are in the definition of what blockchain technology’s full capabilities entail. Like you, I am keen to see the direction all this takes.Blockchain and IoT AllianceThe number of devices controlled by the Internet of Things is expected to hit 26 billion in 2019. However, more than half of all businesses cannot detect whether their device has been exposed to a security breach.Watson IoT
